trustfund:
TF020873-RECONSTRUCTION PROGRAM
            PREPARATION (BANK EX.),TF021051-BOSNIA & HERZEGOVINA
            FORESTRY PROJECT - NORWEGIAN GRANT,TF024091-WOOD SUPPLY AND FOREST
            MANAGEMENT PROJECT - ITALIAN GRANT

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Forestry Project for
            Bosnia and Herzegovina were as follows: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The lessons
            learned indicate that in a country, like Bosnia and
            Herzegovina, with strong traditions in the forest sector,
            benefits of Bank assistance lie in sector reform and
            institutional strengthening as well as the introduction of
            modern technologies. Nevertheless, the lesson is that
            initial emphasis on technical investments can achieve
            immediate impacts on the ground and can build trust as well
            as momentum for institutional reforms. In the Bosnia and
            Herzegovina (BiH) forest sector, the Bank was seen as a
            trusted broker, and as a result, it helped achieve consensus
            between varying stakeholder interests, as well as among
            sub-sectors. The lesson is that support for a participatory
            approach to institutional reform is more likely to be
            successful than a purely technical approach. Project
            implementation was initiated in a post-conflict situation,
            yet it was successful. The lesson is that Bank support for
            technical issues in a divided country can help bring about
            broader based trust and collaboration between stakeholders.
            Reform processes need enough time to mature and to convince
            all stakeholders and that the speed of change varies from
            country to country. Therefore, facilitators of reforms need
            to stay involved in order to sustain processes after they
            are initiated.  The lesson is that patience and continued
            support are needed to bring about sustainable reform. The
            project included a range of financing instruments including
            grant funding for capacity building. The lesson is that
            projects seeking to achieve institutional reform benefit
            from a mix of credit and grant funding.
